column1: Sunnyvale () is a city located in Santa Clara County

column1: Sunnyvale is the 7th most populous city in the San Francisco Bay Area and one of the major cities comprising Silicon Valley. It is bordered by portions of San Jose to the north
column2: Moffett Federal Airfield to the northwest
column4: Los Altos to the southwest
column5: Cupertino to the south
column6: and Santa Clara to the east. It lies along the historic El Camino Real and Highway 101.

column1: As part of California's high-tech area known as Silicon Valley
column2: Sunnyvale is the headquarters location of many technology companies and is a major operating center for many more. It is also home to several aerospace/defense companies. Sunnyvale was also the home to Onizuka Air Force Station
column3: often referred to as "the Blue Cube" due to the color and shape of its windowless main building. The facility
column4: previously known as Sunnyvale Air Force Station
column5: was named for the deceased Space Shuttle Challenger astronaut Ellison Onizuka.  It served as an artificial satellite control facility of the U.S. military until August 2010 and has since been decommissioned and demolished.

column1: Martin Murphy Jr. came to California with his father as part of the Stephens-Townsend-Murphy Party in 1844. In 1850
column2: Martin Murphy Jr. bought a piece of Rancho Pastoria de las Borregas for $12
column3: 500. Murphy established a wheat farm and ranch named Bay View. Murphy had the first wood-frame house in Santa Clara County; it was shipped from New England. The house was demolished in 1961 but was reconstructed in 2008 as the Sunnyvale Heritage Park Museum. When he died in 1884
column4: his land was divided among his heirs.

column2: The San Francisco and San Jose Rail Road was allowed to lay tracks on Bay View and established Murphy Station. Lawrence Station was later established on the southern edge of Bay View.
small fruit orchards replaced many large wheat farms
column3: because wheat farming turned uneconomical due to county and property tax laws
column4: imports and soil degradation. In 1871
column5: Dr. James M. Dawson and his wife Eloise (née Jones) established the first fruit cannery in the county. Fruit agriculture for canning soon became a major industry in the county. The invention of the refrigerated rail car further increased the viability of an economy based upon fruit. The fruit orchards became so prevalent that in 1886
column6: the San Jose Board of Trade called Santa Clara County the "Garden of the World".

column2: the Joshua Hendy Iron Works relocated from San Francisco to Sunnyvale after the company's building was destroyed by fire after the 1906 earthquake. The ironworks was the first non-agricultural industry in the town. The company later switched from producing mining equipment to other products such as marine steam engines.

column1: The City of Sunnyvale uses the council-manager form of government
column2: with an city council consisting of seven members elected to fill individual seats. Starting in November 2020
column3: the mayor is directly elected to a four year term in a city-wide election. The six council members are elected to four year terms from six districts in even-year elections.  The vice-mayor is selected from the six city council members by the mayor and city council
column4: serving a one-year term. The city council hires a city manager to run the day-to-day operations of the city government.Sunnyvale is the largest city in the United States that uses a consolidated department of public safety
column5: with sworn officers who are fully cross-trained to perform police
column7: and emergency medical services. Officer assignments are rotated annually
column8: with some specialtist assignments lasting up to five years. Sunnyvale has had a consolidated DPS since 1950.In the California State Legislature
column9: Sunnyvale is in the  13th Senate District
column12: represented by Democrat Marc Berman.In the United States House of Representatives
column13: Sunnyvale is in California's  17th congressional district
column14: represented by Democrat Ro Khanna.As of August 16

Sunnyvale is served by Santa Clara Valley Transportation Authority (light rail and buses) and by Caltrain commuter rail. Two Caltrain stations are located in Sunnyvale:  the Sunnyvale Station in the Heritage District downtown
column2: and the Lawrence Station in eastern Sunnyvale

column1: Sunnyvale has been listed by the League of American Bicyclists as a bronze-level Bicycle Friendly Community.The Bicycle and Pedestrian Advisory Committee advises the city council on the continued development of the bicycle plan for the city.

column1: Sunnyvale has consistently ranked as one of the safest ten cities (for cities of similar size) in the United States according to the FBI's crime reports. From 1966 to at least 2004
column2: Sunnyvale never placed below fifth in safety rankings among U.S. cities in its population class. In 2005
column3: Sunnyvale ranked as the 18th-safest city overall in the U.S.
column4: according to the Morgan Quitno Awards. In 2009
column5: Sunnyvale was ranked 7th in U.S. by Forbes Magazine in an analysis of America's safest cities. In 2018
column6: Sunnyvale as named the safest city by SmartAsset.com for the third year in a row.According to Sunnyvale's Department of Public Safety
